metadata.title: CVE-2016-7498 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenStack Compute (nova) 13.0.0 does not properly delete instances fromcompute nodes, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial ofservice (disk consumption) by deleting instances while in the resize state.NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of a CVE-2015-3280 regression.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7498` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-api - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-api-ec2 - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-api-metadata - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-api-os-compute - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-api-os-volume - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-baremetal - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-cells - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-cert - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-common - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-compute - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-compute-kvm - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-compute-libvirt - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-compute-lxc - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-compute-qemu - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-compute-vmware - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-compute-xen - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-conductor - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-console - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-consoleauth - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-network - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-novncproxy - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-objectstore - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-scheduler - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-spiceproxy - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-volume - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
nova-xvpvncproxy - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
python-nova - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nova package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.6').
